_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.1      Introduction 

Pursuant to the requirements contained in Chapter 6.95, Article 2 of the California Health & Safety Code 25531 through 25543.3, and the Clean Air Act 112r and Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Part 68, this Risk Management Plan (RMP) is submitted on behalf of International Rectifier.  This program is implemented in California as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program. 
             
1.2      General Description of the Facility and Regulated Substance 

International Rectifier (IR) is a semiconductor manufacturing company, providing design, development, manufacturing and testing of semiconductor devices.  The facility is located on the east and west sides of Kansas Street between Franklin Street and Holly Avenue.  The entire site comprises about 11 acres.  Residential areas fronting on Holly Avenue lie immediately to the north, and eastern border of IR comprises general commercial establishments and corporate multi-story buildings adjoining Sepulveda Blvd.  There are mixed residential and industrial facilities to the west of IR. 

IR uses anhydrous ammonia in two wastewater treatment systems.  The amount of anhydrous ammonia used exceeds the threshold limits established in the federal RMP and CalARP programs.  Therefore, a RMP is required.  The process is subject to RMP Program Level 2.

1.3      Summary of the Five- Year Accident History 

There have been no accidental releases from the ammonia usage operation at International Rectifier in the past five years that have resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known off site deaths, injuries, and evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage (Statute: 40 CFR 68.42). 

1.4      Summary of Prevention Program

The ammonia usage and handling operation at International Rectifier Products is covered by an accidental release prevention program which includes the following: 

?    Rigorous monitoring prog

ram by IR sta
?    Periodic hazard reviews and updates. 
?    Periodic audits of the system and its operation. 
?    Emergency response plan that is coordinated with local emergency response agencies. 

1.6      Summary of the Emergency Response Program 

International Rectifier maintains its Emergency Response program.  Key components of this program include: 

?    Specific actions to be taken in response to,
   o     Ammonia release emergencies
   o     Severe damage resulting from natural causes, accidents, or sabotage 
   o     Fire or explosions 

?    Procedures to notify local and public agencies including the Fire Department, the Office of Emergency Services and the National Response Center as necessary.
?    A list of resources for emergency health care. 
?    Information regarding the training of employees.
